wikipedia_page.main: Emily Nonnen (22 February 1812 — 19 January 1905) was a British-Swedish writer, translator and artist.

response: Her charitable work was described by Fredrika Bremer and Emily Nonnen for Wilhelmina Stålberg, who included her in her dictionary of notable Swedish women in 1864. In 1864, Lotten Wennberg was granted a golden medal for her work in Stockholm by king Charles XV of Sweden. She died of cancer. After her death, the queen, Louise of the Netherlands, founded the charity society Lotten Wennbergs fond för hjälpbehöfvande (The Lotten Wennberg Fund for the Needing) to her memory.

Amongst its staff were the educator Helena Eldrup (up to 1835) and the reforming educator Cecilia Fryxell (in 1846–1847), and among its students were the writer Emily Nonnen, and the reforming pedagogue Mathilda Hall, who in 1857 founded the successor school to Societetsskolan: Mathilda Halls Skola ('Mathilda Hall's School').
* Emily Nonnen, a British-Swedish writer, translator and artist
